thread.title: Lady Gaga's acting debut as bloodsucking fashionista in American Horror Story
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga's acting debut as bloodsucking fashionista in American Horror Story

author: Kylie Northover
title: Lady Gaga's acting debut as bloodsucking fashionista in American Horror Story
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Video will begin in 5 seconds.
Don't play Play now More video Recommended Replay video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Trailer - American Horror Story: Hotel Lady Gaga stars in the fifth season of American Horror Story, set in the Hotel Cortez.
PT0M29S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-44ezw 620 349 October 13, 2015 - 12:19PM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Pop provocateur Lady Gaga made her acting debut last night on the latest series of American Horror Story: Hotel , fast-tracked from the US to Channel Ten.
And there could not be a more perfect role for the controversial singer.
The anthology series, created by Ryan Murphy and Brad Fulchuk, has built up a reputation over its preview four seasons for high-camp gore - and American Horror Story: Hotel looks set to outdo the previous four (possibly even in the first episode alone), with Gaga as the central villain, The Countess, a "bloodsucking fashionista".
Lady Gaga reveals her American Horror Story look on Instagram. 
The Countess owns the spooky Hotel Cortez in downtown LA, an art deco time capsule where she 'lives' with her 10 vampire children, her partner Donovan (Matt Bomer) and a fabulous wardrobe - in the first episode alone Gaga's couture-clad vampire has at least four outrageous costume changes. And she only makes her appearance halfway through the episode. Enough time, though for a foursome that turns into a brutal double murder though, of course.
Advertisement Appearing on US talk show  Jimmy Fallon last week, Gaga said she had long been a horror fan.
"Dangerous things and horror movies are relaxing to me," she said. "I like watching slasher films - it calms me down!"
The Countess in full flight. 
She said she was "acquainted" with the art of darkness.
"I know it's not for everyone. I imagine I would've been one of Hitchcock's groupies. I love it so much - that dichotomy of sex and horror at the same time - there's something fascinating in that."
Also starring Sarah Paulson as a junkie prostitute, Kathy Bates as the hotel receptionist and Dennis O'Hare as 'Liz Taylor', a cross-dressing bellhop, the new American Horror Story will also feature a slew of celebrity guest stars including Michelle Pfeiffer, Alexander Skasgard and Naomi Campbell.
The there are all the other murderous subplots this season, including the Ten Commandments Killer and The Addiction Demon (no, really), who roams the hotel armed with a drill-bit dildo.
Even though she uttered only a handful of lines in the series opener, it's clear Gaga and AHS are a perfect match.
American Horror Story airs on Eleven on Mondays at 9:30 and on TenPlay .
